New Records: Yordan Alvarez became the second Astros player in history to hit at least 30 homers in four consecutive seasons
Key Match Events: Yordan Alvarez hit his 29th and 30th homers of the season, including a leadoff homer to center in the sixth off Sam Long
Pre-Game Insights: There are no pre-game insights mentioned in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Astros manager Joe Espada said 'That's a pretty good Royals team... We went to Kansas City and we were not playing our best, but that's why you play 162. We are getting closer to our goal, and we’re playing with a different intensity and focus and we demonstrated that this series.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros swept the four-game series and have won five in a row, improving to a season-high 13 games over.500 and are a Major League best 68-43 since April 27
Others: Yordan Alvarez was starting to wonder if he’d ever hit another home run at Minute Maid Park, especially after rocketing a ball that had a 109.6 mph exit velocity in the eighth inning of Thursday’s win over the Royals and watching it get caught in front of the Houston bullpen in right-center field.
